file_name: PlayboyEnterprisesInc_20090220_10-QA_EX-10.2_4091580_EX-10.2_Content License Agreement_ Marketing Agreement_ Sales-Purchase Agreement2.txt

perturbation.original_text: By execution of this Supplier/Subcontractor Contract ("Contract"), _______________ ("Supplier")  agrees and  acknowledges that: (i) all images and/or trademarks, including, but not limited to PLAYBOY, (the "Playboy Properties")  applied at the request of _______________ ("Purchaser")  to merchandise covered by this Contract are owned by  Playboy Enterprises International, Inc. ("Playboy"), and when used upon merchandise means that such merchandise is  sponsored, approved, recommended or sold by Playboy or its licensees; (ii) Supplier will not sell, ship or otherwise  dispose of any such merchandise except upon the order of Purchaser or Playboy; (iii) Supplier will never make, cause others to make or assist others in making, any claim whatsoever to any or all of the Playboy Properties or any trademark,  copyright, designation, name, phrase, design or symbol similar thereto in connection with the manufacture, advertising,  promotion, sale or distribution of merchandise; and (iv) Supplier will defend, indemnify and hold harmless Purchaser and Playboy and the distributors and dealers and the officers and employees of each of the foregoing against all liability  whatsoever which may be incurred by them or any of them as a result of any alleged defects in material or workmanship  in the merchandise covered by this Contract.
perturbation.changed_text: By execution of this Vendor/Subcontractor Contract ("Contract"), _______________ ("Supplier")  agrees and  acknowledges that: (i) all images and/or trademarks, including, but not limited to PLAYBOY, (the "Playboy Properties")  applied at the request of _______________ ("Client")  to merchandise covered by this Contract are owned by  Playboy Enterprises International, Inc. ("Playboy"), and when used upon merchandise means that such merchandise is  sponsored, approved, recommended or sold by Playboy or its licensees; (ii) Vendor will not sell, ship or otherwise  dispose of any such merchandise except upon the order of Client or Playboy; (iii) Supplier will never make, cause others to make or assist others in making, any claim whatsoever to any or all of the Playboy Properties or any trademark,  copyright, designation, name, phrase, design or symbol similar thereto in connection with the manufacture, advertising,  promotion, sale or distribution of merchandise; and (iv) Supplier will defend, indemnify and hold harmless Client and Playboy and the distributors and dealers and the officers and employees of each of the foregoing against all liability  whatsoever which may be incurred by them or any of them as a result of any alleged defects in material or workmanship  in the merchandise covered by this Contract.
perturbation.explanation: The terms "Supplier", "Vendor", and "Purchaser" and "Client" are used interchangeably without clear definition. This creates ambiguity as to which entity is bound by which obligation, leading to potential disputes regarding fulfillment and liability. Specifically, 'Vendor' is used in point (ii) but 'Supplier' is used in other sections of the same paragraph, causing confusion.

perturbation.original_text: Supplier agrees that no production or manufacture of any merchandise covered by this Contract will commence until this  Contract has been signed, dated and returned by Supplier to Purchaser. Supplier further agrees that it will not produce,  cause to be produced or assist in the production of more units than are specified by Purchaser nor will Supplier produce, cause to be produced or assist in the production of any product or item not specifically requested by Purchaser using any  or all of the Playboy Properties or any trademark, copyright, designations, names, phrases, designs or symbols similar to  any or all of the Playboy Properties during or at any time after the completion of merchandise requested by this Contract.
perturbation.changed_text: Supplier agrees that no production or manufacture of any merchandise covered by this Contract will commence until this  Contract has been signed, dated and returned by Vendor to Customer. Supplier further agrees that it will not produce,  cause to be produced or assist in the production of more units than are specified by Customer nor will Supplier produce, cause to be produced or assist in the production of any product or item not specifically requested by Purchaser using any  or all of the Playboy Properties or any trademark, copyright, designations, names, phrases, designs or symbols similar to  any or all of the Playboy Properties during or at any time after the completion of merchandise requested by this Contract.
perturbation.explanation: Here, the terms 'Purchaser', 'Vendor', and 'Customer' are used interchangeably. It is unclear who the 'Supplier' should return the signed contract to ('Vendor' or original 'Purchaser' or 'Customer'). Similarly, the 'Supplier' is prohibited from producing more units than specified by both the Customer and original Purchaser. The entities' specific instructions could differ, causing conflict and uncertainty in fulfilling the contract. This ambiguity could lead to disputes over performance obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Supplier will, upon request from Purchaser or Playboy, deliver to Purchaser or will destroy in the presence of Purchaser  or its representative(s), all molds, designs or any other elements used in reproducing any or all of the Playboy Properties.
perturbation.changed_text: Supplier will, upon request from Client or Playboy, deliver to Customer or will destroy in the presence of Purchaser or its representative(s), all molds, designs or any other elements used in reproducing any or all of the Playboy Properties.
perturbation.explanation: This section uses 'Client', 'Purchaser', and 'Customer' inconsistently. The 'Supplier' is instructed to deliver to 'Customer' if requested by the 'Client' but destruction must happen in the presence of the original 'Purchaser'. If 'Client', 'Purchaser', and 'Customer' are separate entities, these obligations could cause logistical problems and disputes regarding compliance with contract terms. It is unclear which entity has the authority to request delivery or oversee destruction, creating potential for disagreements and non-compliance.
